Had another great dinner here.  For a saturday night we got seated in about 20 minutes, slightly under the expected wait time.  The wait staff was excellent all through our meal and the working together was excellent.  Our waitress was particularly great at timing the courses so that we had time to enjoy each one.  Everything was great but the salad dressings were outstanding.  We had the house and blue cheese dressings.  The only thing we couldn't enjoy was dessert because we had no room left.  But seeing everyone around us dnjoying them is a good sign.   Maybe next time we will reverse the order.  We will be back, it's worth the 95 minute drive.

I had the Sicilian crust pizza here last week and it was fabulous!! Very light crust, crispy on the bottom and the sauce was perfect. I am a hard to please pizza eater from New York and this was great. The service was fantastic and the merlot was great too! The pizza was so big for us three adults, I took home about six pieces and they were even better reheated in the oven!

Completely terrible!!!!! They bring you the wrong glass of wine and when it is not taken off of the check,  the "floor manager" - "Tyler" comes to the table to announce he normally doesn't take it off when half of it is gone???? Trust me, ... I would have drank it if it was good!!! Not sure who drank it from the time it left our table but are you kidding me ????????? The food was also mediocre for claiming to be a "true" Italian place!!!  This place deserves NO STARS but you can't post your message unless you put at least 1 !!

Best Italian food I have ever had. A neighbor of mine recommended this place and he didn't steer me wrong. The calamari to start was great. Their bread could be better but who wants to fill up on that! I ordered the chicken Gorgonzola and oh my gosh! The first bite in and I said wow! It was so delicious. My parents were delighted with their food as well. The service was prompt and we all left saying that was some of the best food we've had before. I highly recommend this place.

A generous antipasto, full of fresh ingredients with a flavorful dressing started our meal. Our pizza was delivered before our second mouthful of salad. It to was fresh with generous toppings but a bit dry with to little sauce for my taste. When near to Arboretum give it a try!
No question best pizza that I have had in a really long time. Always friendly. Always on time when I order take out. Price is about right for the quality, did I say fresh ingredients ?  Yup.   Fresh.

This is probably one of our new favorite authentic Italian restaurants. You can tell they come from a rich Italian history with each and every dish. They have so many options, and we haven't gone wrong with anything we've had there before.   We were with another couple and decided to skip appetizers since we knew how much food was coming our way. The other couple ordered a "small" white pizza and cheesy bread. The pizza was much larger than expected and neither of them left hungry. I didn't try it but they said it was very good. My boyfriend got the old try and true, chicken parmesan with angel hair pasta and he left with a clean plate (completely stuffed). I chose to go with the stuffed eggplant which was an eggplant rolatini stuffed with ricotta cheese and ham and it was very very good. The sauce used here is more of a sweet sauce, which is different than what I'm used to but it tastes very fresh and I would prefer that over canned sauce any day.   The service was great, the food was hot, delicious, and very reasonably priced and I will most definitely be back again.

In town for one night and tried to find the best Italian food possible.  I found it!  Just back from Italy for a week and didn't notice a difference.  I wish I could give it 10 stars!  I'll be back every chance I get.

First time here and it was GREAT! From the atmosphere, to the food and even the waiting staff. I'm a simple gal and I got just your basic chicken Alfredo the portion size was just what I was looking for! Big and tasty! I'll definitely will be back for more!

I have to admit that I haven't been to many pizza places in Charlotte since moving here, but this is the best pizza I've eaten here. The prices aren't too bad either. The last time we went, we ended the meal with a cannoli. It was delicious too. Sometimes the to-go orders back up and the tables fill up and there isn't anywhere for people to wait. The line will back up into the dining room, so tables near the front have a crowd around them, which can be uncomfortable for the diners.

Absolutely loved everything.  Our first time, but a new family favorite (and we eat out a LOT!). The fresh bread is wonderful, the pizza is by far the best we've had in Charlotte.  Baked sausage and peppers and Cappellini Mediteraneo were both fabulous.  Great service, fair prices, couldn't ask for more.

I really wanted to give this place at least one more star but alas I cannot. My husband and i came here on a Friday night and it was really dead. We ordered fettuccine and baked ziti. The food was ok. Not exactly wonderful but not bad. It wasn't worth what we paid though.   The server we had was also very rude. We were near the end of our meal and he stood at our table and waited for us to finish eating. Really? There were only 5 other people in the whole restaurant so it's not like he needed the table. Then as we were leaving no one of the 6 servers or hostess we passed said a word to us. No "thanks for coming in." Nothing.   We will not be returning.

You'll almost always have to wait for seating here, but the pizza is a great option for south Charlotte!  They do have a tiny outdoor patio and most of the seating is inside.  Pretty casual atmosphere and great for just grabbing a pie, garlic knots or some other Italian fare!

I did not enjoy my dinner at the restaurant . I ordered the  veal and shrimp. The veal was rubbery and tasteless the shrimp were covered in mozzarella cheese and had no flavor. The sauce tasted like water.  If I hadn't been at the restaurant with other people I would have given this place a one star, but the other couple I was with enjoyed their veal parmesan. just because you put a fancy name on a menu doesn't mean you know how to cook it and this is true with this place. There is more flavor in a jar of ragu then there was on this food. I suggest you try a different restaurant if you want good Italian food.

This location was a disappointment   The location on Park Road is better. From parking to food. Over all more of a hassle of wait and mediocre food. I had a chicken dish and my wife had a pasta entree. Both did not compare to the Park Road location. I do not plan on going back. Maybe we went on an off day and it was just bad luck. If I go back I will update this post.

What a nice find by my daughter Tiffany G. for a homey, neighborhood Italian restaurant.  After Frankie's on Morehead closed, and we moved too far from Ciro's in University City, I didn't realize how much I missed the joyous, casual, celebratory spirit that is unique to the Italians: gioia della vita!  Portofino's delivers.  We reserved a table for six in the corner and raised our glasses to life's blessing last night.  The place was slammed and our waiter never missed a beat.  Thank you!  All the food was very good, and my son's large calzone--wow!  Monstrous.  We joked it looked like a large pizza had fallen out of the oven and they folded it over and served it as a calzone.  Humungous. Understandably, he took 2/3 of it home.  In fact, we ALL took food home; Portofino's is generous with their portions.  And fine on the wallet, too.  An absolute repeat, especially when it comes to family celebrations!

Middle of the road! We ordered a pizza with green peppers, pepperoni and mushrooms, and a dozen of their seasoned wings. I would put the pizza just slightly above Vocelli's: it was hot, but it was greasy and the sauce lacked depth. The wings were fresh, hot and crispy, but they were lightly seasoned and had very little taste. The delivery time was spot-on if not earlier than quoted. Most likely would not order from here again.

The rudest workers. They have no idea how to make certain dishes. Based on the service and the down right rudeness, I would not go back here. They better learn how to run a business and speak to their customers. They should also learn to check their to go orders before they give to you and you drive all the way home. Would be nice for them to compensate us for the error on their part after we had to drive all the way back. I have had this happen before at other establishments and they have been kind about it as well as made up for it, mistakes happen. As long as you handle it correctly, I would go back to those restaurants. Would not go back here!
The BEST Chicken Piccata in town.  It's my favorite dish my mom makes and no one has ever come close to making it so good.  It's still not as good as mom's but it's darn close!

Why, hello Italian restaurant tucked away in a Harris Teeter shopping area. Come to find out, this place has been here a while and that the owners are from Italy. Who knew?!  There's a nice sized patio and a pretty spacious interior (you would have no idea by looking at it from the exterior). It's a warm atmosphere.   The entrees are of large portion! The lasagna was tasty and the salmon salad was very good! The service was friendly and attentive! I hear that their pizza is really good...I'll save that for next time.  I plan on returning to try the other tasty dishes!

I've been here a few times now and haven't really been able to find an entr√©e that I would order again. Not much of it seems to have a fresh taste. The pizza is probably the best thing on the menu.   They always seem busy so maybe it's just me.

It was good. The family agreed on their meals that it was just good. Would have rather had garlic breadsticks if some kind with meal instead of the French loaf. Male hostess and female waitress were nice and service was excellent  Spaghetti with meatballs. Penne with meat sauce and cheese ravioli with tomato sauce is what is pictured

So this is a local "chain". I use chain loosely but these guys have a few locations around town. I used to live behind this location but I hadn't eaten here before until after I ate at the other one in Ayrsley. Anyways it's good, but not as good as their Ayrsley location. The menus also have a slight variance so my favorite dish isn't offered at this location. I don't live near this one anymore so it's doubtful I'd be back. Don't get me wrong the food is good, but I've been spoiled by other Italian and by the other location as it, after all, has my favorite dish that they serve.

I am a BIG fan of the Park Rd location (which is closer to where I live and work), but decided to take mom by the Arboretum location (over by Michael's and Versona) to try one of their delicious subs.  The Arboretum location is smaller and more intimate than the Park Rd shop, few seats, but comfortable and clean.  The waitress was an absolute delight - all smiles and she, along with the other staff, kept our drinks filled and made sure we had everything we needed.    My FAVORITE is the cheese steak, which I ordered the 7" as to not get the "look" from my mom about ordering the 11".  Steak, cheese, onions, peppers and crusty bread served with their fries (chips come with, fries are $1 more and well worth it).  Delicious!  Mom is a big fan of veal (I don't eat veal, but I do eat beef, I realize my hypocrisy, but it is what it is), so she ordered the 7" veal parmesan, and declared it to be the best veal parm sandwich that she has ever had.  She ooh'ed and ahh'ed her way through it and said how tender and delicious it was.  A happy mom is what is most important to me.  Great visit, great location, should I be in the Arboretum again, I would not hesitate to stop by for a cheese steak (or pizza, or pasta... I love Portofino).

The service was great & food was amazing.  Only downfall, server didn't go over the specials. We didn't see the board, as we were seated quickly & saw it as were leaving, and would have liked tohave tried them.  We got the tiramisu to go and it was perfect!! Definitely be back!!
Update #754 for me for this location - the dbag waiter is no longer at this location, so now I can go back to my weekly visits for CHEESE STEAKS and/or pasta.  HOORAY!
Great pizza and menu in general - only problem is that the restaurant is way too small and you sit on top of one another.

ALWAYS an outstanding choice for Italian! Been here many times, and it's always excellent food for a very reasonable price.  If you have not eaten their "Chicken Portofino," you MUST give this a try! OMG it is SOOOOOOOOOOO good. It's Chicken breast dipped in flour and saut√©ed with mushrooms, ham and onions in a cream sauce. That CREAM sauce is to die for! For those of you who know me, I'm a pretty darn good cook who's been taught how to make classic French sauces through my Johnson & Wales Chef Choice classes. Well this one is textbook cream sauce (though Italian not French). You can taste the butter and cream, and it makes this dish heavenly. I don't know how else to describe that taste. I've ordered this dish a dozen times before and each time it has been consistently prepared, and consistently AWESOME!  My date ordered their Osso Bucco special. She never had that before and she loved it! I tasted it and it was cooked to perfection. That slow braise did the trick. Super moist and tender, and very flavorful.  TIP: Ask for their "Portofino House Red Wine" and they'll bring you a Venetian Ripasso, which I call the "baby Amarone." For $32 bucks you get an excellent bottle of red wine which drinks much better than the $32 price point....at least it does to my wine palate!  Just love this place. Hope you enjoy it as well!

First time here, and for sure last. My husband asked for fried calamari on his seafood pizza, the waiter said ok. 3 min later...he says "Manager said NO"....not once did manager come to explain why not...we even said we were willing to pay extra he still said "sorry Manager said no". Not having a correct answer and Manager not even coming to explain means customers are not priority. Girl that was training with main waiter was very sweet and she was very understanding with us. Im new to charlotte coming from tourism capital Orlando, FL and im used to great service. Lets say I wont come back. Food was okay. Mellow Mushroom has better pizza.

Service, cleanliness, food, was excellent! We enjoyed an antipasto for an appetizer, wine, two entr√©es (lasagna and chicken parm) which came with bread and salad. The entrees are HUGE and very delicious. I want to get dessert, but was too full. This is my Italian spot in Charlotte. Most defiantly will recommend.

We picked up pizza here last weekend. Crust was good - could really taste the oven (maybe a touch overcooked?). Unlike many other Charlotte pizza places, the ingredients tasted fresh and nutritious. Staff were friendly and the dining area looked nice (as I ran in to pick up the order). We also ordered tiramisu and cheesecake for dessert (just to make our meal extra healthy), and they were great. Not the best pizza in Charlotte, but definitely worth trying/ getting from time to time, and we will definitely eat there soon to try some of the non-pizza offerings.

Did not know about this restaurant and came here because of a colleague's recommendation.  As we entered the restaurant, the hostess was figuring out where to seat the patron in front of us. Martino, the head server/waiter came over and asked will that be two for dinner? Would you like the patio or inside? The hostess came back and wanted to seat us near the entrance and we said no. We ended up with the table after the one by the entrance area.  Here is my review for the food and the service at Portofino's.  Ordered two appetizers  Fried Calamari- lightly breaded and fresh even the sauce was delicious. Not greasy or overly fried.  Roasted Peppers and Mozzarella- The mozzarella was fresh and roasted pepper were sweet.  Salad  Asked for a Cesar Salad with Anchovies and they made it to our specification. This is definitely impressive. Most places serve only what is listed on the menu.   Entrees  Rock Salt fish with Shrimp and Linguini- My friend enjoyed his meal.  Veal Saltinbocca Ala Romana- Prosciutto with melted mozzarella on top of veal which was so flavorful and tasty. Would have preferred the spinach to be on the side instead of on top of the veal.   Dessert  Homemade Tiramisu with a cup of cappuccino. Delicioso! Got my sugar fix for the rest of the evening.  This is definitely an authentic Italian restaurant.

Hm, it was a 3 star eating experience.  The service was fast and the food was fast too.  We were seated immediately and asked for drinks within 15 seconds. We ordered a large pizza for the four of us and a tossed salad to share.  The salad came out fast and tasted perfect except for a few pieces of lettuce that were soggy. Then the pizza came out and tasted average...The crust was slightly burnt and could have used some more butter around the edges.

It had been years since I had eaten at this location.  I have been to the one at Ayrsley a few times and it was just blah.  I decided to go back to this location and was glad I did.  The food was so much better and everyone working was very nice.  I ordered a gnocchi dish and while the gnocchi was definitely not made from scratch, the read meat sauce was delicious.  My friend had the baked ziti (which I usually get)  and loved it.  This location seems to have t together and will be the one I go to henceforth.  Lunch prices are pretty reasonable too.
Had a wonderful dinner there recently. Very good food, service, ambiance, and price. I'm hooked.

Portofino's is the kind of restaurant I can get behind. A small local chain with great food, equally great staff, and a warm and inviting atmosphere. I've ate there twice and both times were good experiences. Their food is hearty and filling and a notch above anything I could concoct in my kitchen. The chicken portofino has everything Italian food should in my opinion, alot of well seasoned tender meat, rich creamy sauce, and a huge helping with enough for leftovers. The shrimp parmigiana isn't quite as perfect, but I still enjoyed it and like that they use really fresh jumbo shrimp. Kudos for their tomato sauce too, some places have a tendency to make theirs overly sweet, but Portofino's keeps their sauce a little tangy, just as a tomato should taste.  I feel that great service can make average food subconsciously taste better, but luckily the quality of their food and service shine through in both areas. Their staff is superbly friendly and they come by frequently to check on things. They clearly want you to have a great meal, and as you can probably tell by my review, I like Portofino's quite alot. Skip the 45 minute waits at Olive Garden and come here, you'll leave with a full belly and a smile on your face.
Never disappoints...food is great...staff is friendly and accommodating...no complaints!!!

In Charlotte, this place is good as it gets. It stacks up against the heavy hitters in Boston and New York. I had the veal Marcella which was fantastic. The service was great as well and don't you dare leave without a slice of their signature dessert Tiramisu. Enjoy

Every now and then I just have to go gnab a big plate full of mollusks. The "Scungilli and Calamari" entree (evidently scungilli is Italian for conch) certainly delivers on that front. In addition to the plate reaching approximately to the South Carolina border, the pasta was utterly swamped in calamari rings and conch strips. I am pretty sure an entire reef's inventory of squid went into this dish. I certainly can't ding Portofino for skimping on the portions.  While I enjoyed the calamari, I was disappointed to discover that the conch was really rubbery and almost challenging to get through it all. Even though I just ate here last night, I really can't recall anything about the sauce, which tells you a lot about how interesting it must have been. Also, the salad went for the "Titanic" approach by seemingly having crashed into an entire head of Iceberg lettuce.  Nothing too exciting here, but Portofino is a nice little neighborhood Italian hangout where you can grab an enormous mound of decent pasta on the cheaps.
Great food but an on line menu might help drum up some additional business

Seemingly always crowded, but for a restaurant that is a good thing: it lets you know that other people enjoy it.  I have been here twice now for dinner, and the wait hasn't been too terrible. The service was good, considering how busy they were, and the food was good to very good.  During my most recent visit, I had the lasagna, which was very rich and large-portioned. I can generally eat a good bit, especially of Italian food, but that evening I had a nice bit to take home as leftovers.  My girlfriend at the time said the Tiramisu was very good as well.  Prices are maybe a bit higher than some other Italian restaurants in the area, but you get a lot of food for the money, so that's not a big deterrent for me.

Both locations of Portofino offer great Italian comfort food.  This place offers great pasta and meat dishes, and also has great pizza.  The pirces are moderate but the portions are large enough to account for them.  I love to get take-out from this place because it can be a bit crowded for dinner.  The house salad dressing is really great, and a side salad is the perfect addition to a pizza.
Great spot. Love their pasta dishes and they have great sandwiches as well. Not many know, but they probably have the best Philly cheesesteak in Charlotte

How can something so simple be so GOOD?  Basic New York style pizza, love the thin crust, flavorful sauce and perfect amount of cheese.  Pasta dishes are fresh and delicious as well.  Service is good and prices reasonable.

We get take out from Portofino's frequently. I really enjoy the tortellini gorgonzola, but all the  food is always excellent. The only issue is the guy taking phone orders. He's so abrupt and ready to get off the phone you feel like you won't get your food if you don't order properly, like the soup nazi.
I ordered from these guys the night I moved into my house last year and have tried to make it a weekly affair since. Great pizza, pepperoni rolls, and quick delivery. Thanks!

I think what bothers me most about this place is the lack of customer service. I keep coming back because the food is good. My family and I have tried this place more than a handful of times hoping that the lack of service was just a fluke. But no, it's not. Everything we walk through the front door, I have yet to get a smile and "welcome to portfinos" we just get "how many?". The cooks are right by the entrance too. They see everyone that walks through the door. They could say hello and give a smile or welcome to portofinos, but no. So- I give this place a 3 star because of the lack of hospitality. If they stepped up their greetings at the door, I would give them a 4 star because I do like their food.
This place needs to update their hours because apparently at 11 o'clock when they say they close at one they don't pick up the phone

Lovely and reasonably priced spot for good Italian food. We enjoy dining on the patio and the service had been consistently good. We prefer the pastas and pizzas, with good noodles and quality crust. The salad and bread the accompany the entrees are also excellent. We typically don't even need and appetizer and have plenty of leftovers to take home (not often the case for us elsewhere!). I have yet to try dessert because I've been so full after my meal but look forward to doing so. This spot makes you forget you're in a strip mall and is great for a date night, family outing, or celebration. Lunch prices are especially good.

My favorite Italian restaurant in Charlotte great for dine in as well as carryout.  I love this place everything here is amazing but my go to meal options are the chicken and veal parmigiana (I prefer the veal), great pizza, and I love the stromboli as well as the mozzarella sticks. The house dressing for the salads is also the way to go, delicious.  You truly get your money's worth here the portions are HUGE.  The HIDDEN TREASURE here is the philly cheese steak the best one I have had in Charlotte. (picture coming soon as in the next time I go)

Fantastic osso bucco, grilled chicken cutlet parm. I heard that they have chicken cacciatore so definitely have to try that!! It's alot of work so can't wait to test it out. The bruschetta is wonderful and I want to try the calimari as it seems to be made in flour. Awesome restaurant and I can not believe I missed this gem.

Hands down the best Italian food in Charlotte! My wife and I go regularly and it's always consistently excellent. The restaurant does need some updating but we go for the food. We drive close to 30 minutes to go here for lunch that's how much we enjoy it.

I love this pizza place! I eat here at least 3 times a week for lunch during work. I usually order a salad or a pizza or a hoagie. I have never been disappointed. One time my order was incorrect they immediately fixed it and I was of course satisfied. They have the best sausage pizza!

This is my first time at this Portofinos location and food is consistent at all the locations in my opinion. I am a big fan of their pepperoni pizza, it is always great ! I decided to try one of their pasta dishes this time. The shrimp scampi was amazing ! It was flavorful and the lemon was just enough, not over powering. The shrimp where huge and the portion size are big as well. Very well possible to share for 2 people. Nice atmosphere and good customer service.

Planned to visit this Italian cuisine on a Saturday night - expecting a large crowd we went early but surprised to get ourselves a table. The restaurant wasn't too crowded and there were enough waiters around every table. We went directly for the entree or Pasta to be specific. I got some Bolognese with Fettuccini which came with a Salad and Bread. Our waiter was very happy to fill up the Bread as soon as we finished it. The Salad came in and I was not thoroughly impressed with it - looked more like already prepared and the lettuce wasn't so fresh. The main dish came in -  Bolognese, the meat and sauce were mild and alright. I wasn't too impressed with the dish but it wasn't a let down too.
Food was delicious!! I ordered 3 musketeers , shrimp, veal, & chicken parm with gnocchi
I love this place! My boyfriend and I just went to Italy this summer and it took months for us to crave Italian food again. Portofino's doesn't disappoint with their authentic Italian menu offerings.
Always good if you're just looking for a classic pizza. They never disappoint.  Pepperoni can get a little on the greasy side, but that happens almost everywhere.

Portofino's is a nice neighborhood chain Italian restaurant that offers a consistent experience, but nothing sticks out as spectacular.   It was pretty busy when we came in, but service was still fast and friendly. The margherita pizza was just okay, too much sauce and not crispy enough. The gorgonzola tortellini though was pretty good. Super cheesy in the typical Italian fashion. On the plus side we did have some leftovers for the day after.   Just okay, I may or may not visit again.

Portofinos on Park Road is one of the few places I go for good Italian cuisine in the QC.  I'm not saying it's the best Italian I've ever had, but it certainly ranks up there as far as Charlotte goes.  After living in New York for two years, I arrived in Charlotte less than satisfied with the pizza choices.  Portofinos comes CLOSE to having a perfect New York slice of pizza.  I say CLOSE because the cheese and sauce are deliciously tangy, with the perfect amount of spice and sharpness.  The crust is also delicious, and you can tell hand made.  The only reason I'm not giving this place 5 stars is because the crust is a bit thick. I think they could make it a bit thinner and truly have a winner.  The atmosphere is casual and inviting, their pasta dishes are excellent and their house dressing is TO DIE for. It's a cross between a Thousand Island and a French dressing.  If you're craving Italian, this place won't let you down.

Great food but the wait staff is off putting, our waitress  seemed  bored and not wanting to be their with a rushed attitude towards us. Unfortunately I was hopping this would be my go to neighborhood restaurant but scratch that idea.
Reasonably priced lunch considering the huge portions. I'm here for the Philly cheesesteak!

I've been a regular at portofino's since 1996. But for some reason the pizza is not nearly as good.  The last time we went we had to bring the pizza back it was hard and there was no cheese on it. Me and my husband thought it was fluke. But tonight it was the same thing. It wasn't that ediable.it made my stomach hurt bad I tried to just eat the toppings because the crust was so hard but there was not cheese just a meatball. Needless to say I'm still hungry and I don't fell like driving all the way back to get another one it safe to say I will not return to this location by will go to arslye and park rd

My son and I went in during a lunch break from a local Dr. appointment...we were able to get in and out in about 30 minutes, our server was exceptionally polite and the food was hot and delicious. Their fries are absolutely to die for!

Food was horrible! tonight.    chicken parm. sandwich, soggy!!! no good.    Pasta Primavera, was like eating   pasta with half and half dumped on it!!!!!  no flavor,  too much cream, not enough veggies.   terrible!!!   could not even eat it!!!!

Arboretum location.  Had take out, baked ziti, chicken parm.  Was good, but VERY SALTY!!   I can usually eat a big bowl of pasta/ziti but could hardly eat 1/3 of it.  Please lighten up on the salt.  thank you.  I don't think the Park Rd. location is as salty, I always liked the food there.

This is our go-to place for takeout Pizza. The crust is always on-point, thin, chewy and hand stretched. Ingredients are always great here, starting with the homemade sauce and sausage, all the way to the hand-chopped veggies. Service-wise they are always friendly and efficient.  Recently we actually ate there with a big group - excellent experience. Portions were HUGE, service was very accommodating. The Chicken Parm sandwich in particular is outstanding, especially the hand-breaded chicken and the crusty bread!  Worth coming back to again and again.

Chicken Parm.  Chicken Parm. All day. Every time. Order it. I can't not order it. I can't even explain the feeling of excitement I get when it gets put on the table in front of me.   Everything about this is fantastic. The chicken is cooked just right (could maybe use a little more crisp, meh, i don't need it), the sauce is just right, and the pasta is perfect. The people are friendly, food is good, it gets a little loud when its crowded - but its good. Go here. Take a date here.Take your parents here. If you're single, take me here. haha. I'm going to order the chicken parm.
Good Italian food. Best pizza in town. Dine-in or take-out and you will be happy.  Must be in the sauce
We really enjoy this family restaurant each time we visit, great Italian food and good service. The stuffed eggplant is great and the pasta is always a crowd pleaser.  Good place for everyone
My favorite restaurant in Charlotte! By far!!! I've never had a bad meal there...ever!!! Btw best sangria I've had in my life. Love LOVE this place!!!

I stumbled upon this little place trying to avoid yet another fast food lunch. The place is clean and well staffed. The food was very fresh and was actually NY Style pizza for a change from all the posers. I had the Pasta Primavera. The portion is quite large. I am a glutton and I ended up leaving a quarter of it in the bowl. For $7.95 its very generous. Amazingly fresh cream sauce over your choice of pasta with broccoli spinach and tomatoes. Awesome meal.

This is my first dine-in experience as I've only picked up pizza before. I arrived at 6:15 on a Thursday and possibly got the last table. However it was near the front door do it was chilly and I had to wear my coat the entire time.  My waitress recommended a nice cab blend to start. After reading other posts on here, I already knew I wanted the zuppa de pesce entree. First she brought me bread. It was warm but not great. But I ate more than I should. A house salad came with my meal which was perfectly sized and had nice flavor. The house dressing, a creamy tomato-basil dressing, was delicious!  My meal arrived and my eyes about popped out of my head! It was HUGE and loaded with seafood! Overall it was a somewhat healthy meal as it had a marinara sauce and linguine with even more seafood! Needless to say, I brought home a box and hope it'll be half as good reheated! I'm do glad I ventured out on this crappy night to try Portofinos! I'll definitely be back! (And the pizza I've previously gotten was tasty too!)

We went to Portofino's last night after watching a movie and the service and food were excellent!!  Fantastic choice for my late birthday celebration.  I will definitely go back!  Great tasting food, excellent service and the price is unbeatable!

Portofino serves up delicious Italian food and has an extensive menu, with pasta, meat dishes, pizza and subs. I've been there for dinner a couple times and tried the lasagna and spaghetti and meatballs. I'd recommend both dishes. The servings are pretty large so chances are you'll have leftovers to take home. The warm garlic bread is also a plus, as is the long wine menu. The restaurant has a cute intimate decor and the service is friendly. It's a good dinner spot for a romantic date.

I thought the food was absolutely delicious! I had linguine with clams & was some of the best I've ever had. The BF had a sub and said it was normal/average. The decor is just thrown up on the wall, nothing to ponder or talk about. Our bill came and it was more expensive than the prices on the menu. When I asked he realized he had charged dinner prices, not lunch menu prices and adjusted it, a $12 correction. For great Italian, highly recommend, for fancy date night/romantic dinner...it's not the place

I heard a lot of good things about this place. Walked in and it was a nice atmosphere. However the food was very bland... the mozzarella sticks were obviously frozen and weren't the best and the pizza was completely bland. There was no flavor to it at all. The waiter was nice which was one of the bright spots but spending 20 bucks on a bland pizza is something I won't do again.

I went with a few friends for dinner last night per their suggestion. There were 5 of us that were sat by the door and they had to add an extra chair to accommodate us. The waitress brought us 2 pieces of bread to start off. When we finished that extremely fast we politely asked for more bread. The waitress said that we could not get anymore bread until we order our food? I have never heard of this in my life... did she think we were going to just snack on the free bread? I ordered the eggplant parm which doesn't come with pasta. It was very bland. The tomato sauce didn't have any flavor and looked to be out of a can and not homemade. For the price and quality I probably will not go back to this location.

We've been regulars at this location for years. But lately, I feel that they've slacked on quality and flavor. The last few times we've eaten here, the food has been bland. Their pizza is still top notch and I love the bruschetta. However, the pasta dishes have been disappointing, with runny sauces and no seasoning. Even a little salt could've helped tonight!

I just have to say that this place has been consistently great. It's our go-to pizza place when NY Pizza is closed, and also when we want to treat ourselves to a fine Italian dish. The food is always fresh, filling and delicious. Plus the service is always delightful. Bravo!
Food was excellent (stuffed shells), service was attentive, prices reasonable.

I chose A-OK rather then being a fan because of the 93 rating. Its a pretty small/intimate seating area and they seem to have a lot of servers.  The bring out bread($1 extra if you don't order entrees) with balsamic vinegar and oil which is pippin hot and delicious.  Entrees are $12.50 & higher but they do come with a side salad.  Baked ziti doesn't have ricotta cheese in it which is a HUGE bummer in my opinion. Pizza is fantastic!!  Not so much the white pizza though.  We would like to go back but will need the sanitation score to be higher.

Portofino's is the best! We order from them for our Office several times a month and we are always very happy! They always pay attention to detail and the food is ready for pick up when they say it will be. Love this place!
Excellent food. Love it here only problem is the booths are SO uncomfortable they sink in badly other than that no problem at all

One of my favorite Italian places in the city. I usually go for the Chicken or Veal Parmigiana. They come with salad and bread so on most occasions I can make two meals out of these heaping portions making it excellent value. Occasionally I will branch out and try other things and everything I had has been delicious and served quickly. Most of my friends come strictly for the pizza. It is hard for me to order one with the afore mentioned items readily available. But on the occasions where I have ordered a pizza, it was really really good with an excellent crust. They also come in HUGE sizes so they are great for a family or a bunch of friends.

I eat here almost every week with a group of friends. The staff is awesome and the food is fantastic.If you like fresh fish this is one of the best places in town!Very kid friendly too.I must mention the pizza...if you like NYC style pizza give this pace a try you won't regret it.

Hubby was craving pasta and we realized we hadn't picked an Italian place in our hood yet! We went to trusty yelp and found this portofinos in the arboretum. We had a great time. After being seated in the nearly full and cozy dining area, our waiter greeted us right away. I asked a ton of questions about the wine list and our waiter was knowledgeable and recommended a great pick. He had perfect timing and checked on us often, he was excellent. Hubs then ordered spaghetti and meatballs and I ordered the salmon with pink sauce. Everything was wonderful! Al dente pasta, perfectly cooked proteins, and flavorful sauce. The dessert plate looked amazing and I definitely want to try in the future, we will be back!

In my opinion, BEST pizza in Charlotte.....and I've tried them all (hawthornes, brixx, intermezzo, luigis, fuel).  The tomato sauce is flavorful; the crust has a homemade fresh taste and the sausage is great as well.    Also, their house salad dressing is amazing.  I would go back just for the dressing.  It's a creamy sundried tomato, garlic, mildly spicey dressing.  Yum.    We went today for Valentines and despite the consistent flow of people, the service was still flawless.    I really want to try something other than the pizza but I enjoy the pizza so much that I don't want to be disappointed.    Our bill for a side salad, medium pizza, garlic bread and a glass of wine was $25.....not bad!  Definitely give it a try (for pizza and a salad at least)!

We used to order at least once a week, (my boyfriend even more before I moved in) we loved their food, until one night we ordered pizza due to having family over(mostly kids) ordered 1/2 plain 1/2 mushroom. When it was delivered the whole thing was covered in pepperoni. Called to complain and was told they would send another up, but we had to return the whole pizza that was ruined, that's fine ( even the delivery driver said he would have let us keep it because they can't sell it). So we let that slide, then a few months later we ordered a pizza, and some pop, after an hour and 40 minutes (mind you I'm at the top of the hill from them) called and had a rude girl say they were closed due to weather (unless the driver had bald tires roads were fine because just got home) but our pizza was on its way, it was ice cold like they left it outside for an hour and then sent it. Never again. I worked in a pizza shop and I would never justify that treatment to someone who ordered weekly.

So let me start off with I order from here every Friday night and sometimes twice a week. I love their salads. The service has gone down hill this past year. I went from five stars to one. I also wanted to see if the second pending charge was dropped before it posted to my account.   So this past Friday April 13th I ordered 2 salads online and they were for pickup. My boyfriend picked them up. When you order online you get email confirmations. Later that night I checked my emails and I had 2 confirmations. I checked my bank account and I was charged twice. I called Portofino's and spoke with Lisa. I explained to her what happened and she goes "hey bill it gets even better" I said excuse me? She goes "listen this isn't my problem, what's your name" so I told her and she found my receipt and said " I only have one charge for you...you were charged once" I said I can send you a screen shot showing I was charged twice she replied go ahead. I said is there an email I can send it to? She said no...I laughed and said how am I supposed to send this to you she said I don't know it's not going to do anything if you send it...this is my problem. She continued to say this goes through a third party and you need to contact them." But she had no information of how to contact them. She was so extremely rude. No customer service. I get it's Friday and you are busy...however all she had to say was I have one charge on my end that I can see, I would wait to see if both post to your account and if they do call the third party and get a refund. Also have the number handy to give to the customer. This is known as customer service. Something Portofino's lacks.  I just called and talked to Shawn the manager and explained this to him. He did help me with the number for the third party and I explained how rude Lisa was. He said he was sorry and that they were busy on Friday..not that was a reason for her to be rude. Nothing more. I thought perhaps he would care when I said how much I order there and how she made me not want to return. He said he was sorry.   So that being said I will no longer order here. I do like the salads and buffalo chicken rolls. However the service is horrible. I have had delivery guys show up with a cigarette hanging out of their mouth. I have received the wrong salad but since I like them all I normally just keep what I got. I have had orders that are missing things. No one seems to care. I'm sure I can find an establishment that cares I am a customer.

Had lunch here yesterday and I was very impressed!  The ambiance is welcoming, and everyone greets you when you walk in.  I had the chef salad which was huge for only $8.50.  Everything was fresh and there was a ton of meat and fresh mozzarella too!  It was so much food I couldn't finish it.   The waitress was very nice and fast to get our order out.  You can tell this place is a local favorite.

In short, this place serves up super tasty Italian food and pizza with local hospitality and charm.  After receiving several recommendations for Portofino's, we finally got around to sampling their fare.  I ordered my standard Italian dish, lasagna bolognese, and my wife ordered a plain cheese pizza.  The lasagna was very good but that pizza?  Oh man, did I order wrong!  I could not stop asking her for just one more bite.  Be aware that this place is like a local version of a Carrabba's or a Macaroni Grill, only with MUCH better food and no cheesy artificial flair.  If you want a family friendly joint to serve up some great tomato sauce and cheese, this is the place.

Porto Finos is just ok. The food is decent-if you're looking for your basic local pizza shop you won't be disappointed with the pie. Other menu offerings are good as well. I've not been to the shop, but gotten delivery. This is where the trouble comes in.   They seem to not have enough people working ever. The last couple of times I've called they have taken WAY too long to answer the phone, then they set the phone down and walk away for a few minutes after hastily asking you to hold, and then when they finally talk to you, they let you know that delivery will take over an hour. Hire a couple more employees for the evenings!   Also, when paying with credit card they require the security code off of the back of the card. Not all places require this and it makes me a bit nervous. This is how people can hack accounts and I just don't like providing it over the phone. The guy who answers the phone will also repeat my credit card information back to me over the phone-in the middle of a crowded pizza shop! Also makes me nervous...and I'm not even a paranoid person. I just think that some things make common sense. Repeating a credit card number in a crowd does NOT make sense.   Overall, they have good food. They could use an improvement in customer service though. Step it up, guys!
The lemon cake is to die for I fell in love with it just as I have the hot dogs you must go and see for yourself take it from someone that order two slices of cake and six hot dogs

Mmmm. They have the most amazing pizza here. And it's not that expensive. The sauce or crust must be loaded with garlic butter, because it is fantastic, yet light at the same time. I say go for it, get a pizza that's loaded, because you won't regret it!

Fantastic little place! Verdict was out when we walked in. Wasn't quite sure what to expect but was pleasantly surprised! Delicious from appetizer to entree to drinks! Def would recommend it with surprisingly cheap prices!

We really do like this place and the food is always on point and great family place. Most of the time we eat in the dining room cause we are with the familia but at times my wife and i eat at the bar. The last 4 times we have eaten at the bar Woody has been our bartender he is absolutely miserable, not only with most of his customers at his bar but how he talks and speaks to his fellow coworkers. Tonight was just bad overall on how he was talking to us and if i was the 2 coworkers he was talking nasty to i would have went off on him at the bar. From now on moving forward if the of us come in to have dinner at the bar and Woody is there we will go somehwere else. I know hes been there forever and the regulars deal with him but enough is enough.

My wife and I came here based on Yelp reviews. We recently moved here from NJ and are always on the lookout for good Italian food.  We started with the calamari, which was large enough for 2. It was average for calamari but the marinara that accompanied it was fantastic. My wife also had the crab bisque soup which she said was outstanding. For the main course my wife had spaghetti with clam sauce and I had eggplant parmesan. Both dishes were plentiful and delicious and we ended up taking half of each home for the next day. Overall an excellent experience. Plan on a wait when arriving as they are often crowded, another sign of good food. We can't wait to return to try other dishes.

This place serves great Italian food!  Plenty of pasta choices and (from what I hear) great pizza as well.  The portions are large enough that you'll want to take half of your dinner home (and quickly devour it the next evening!).  It's kind of fills the same niche as the Olive Garden, but that's not really a fair comparison because Portofino's is more authentic and much tastier.  The service was impeccable.  Drinks stayed refilled and everything was served exactly when expected.  Our waiter was not only pleasant, but entertaining.  He actually seemed to be enjoying his job (imagine that!).  The place is small, but charming.  I imagine they have the draw to fill a larger space, and that would certainly cut down on the wait for a table.

Don't believe the hype! The wait was long, the service was slow and food tasted as if it came from the kitchen of an old country Buffett.  The pizza was very good and had a good NY flop to it.  The chicken Parm wasn't any better that I could get a mom and pops pizza shop.  $65 for 2 kids and 2 adults is to much for this low quality food.

How does this place only have three reviews. I have been going for at least 10 years between this location and Eastway. Best pizza I ever had. It's thin but not too thin you can fold in half and it folds just right. Best crust. We love this place.

I normally only get take out from here (which is always good!) but man was I pleasantly surprised when we actually went in to sit down and eat. We called ahead to put our name on the list since it seems to always be a popular choice, and ended up only waiting 10 minutes. Soooo... we got a glass of the Cabernet the bartender suggested- DELICIOUS!  For appetizers, we ordered the roasted red peppers and mozzarella and the "appetizer for 2" to share. A lot of food but full of flavor! I may add that their calamari is always a winner but we had to try something different for once :-)   For our entree, we split the chicken cacciatore that was served with a white wine sauce. Not sure if I'm wrong here, but I normally make this with a red wine marinara sauce. However, the sauce was absolutely delicious!!! A lot lighter than I typically expect but really good. (Even though we had to take majority of it home!)  Definitely get the house creamy basil dressing! Cant get enough of it.   I also want to add our server was really great. She was super patient with us taking a little extra time to order and splitting an entree. Also, I loved how attentive each and every staff member was to not only our table but each table individually.   Authentic food. Wonderfully sweet staff. And great family/date atmosphere! Great job Portofinos :-)

After ordering from Portofino's three times. I'm ready to review!  Just had my second order at this location and the first time I ordered from the Park Road location.  I will mostly overlook the RUDE hostess in this review.  She turnt out to be rude.  The young platinum blonde hostess greeted me when I came in but I decided not to dine in but was looking for a certain type of meal of the menu.  The manager was attentive and stepped in right away to see what I wanted.  He willing to give me a good price to try a combination.  I decided to give them time for my order so I went to two stores next door just to kill time.  When I arrived back the hostess was outside talking to a friend which I witnessed long before I made an entrance inside.  We were two steps from each other and she walked in ahead of me without holding the door open.  Then greeted me like she had never seen me before so I kindly said I'm picking up my order now ().  Other that that was I was pleased with my meal.  The chicken Parmesan is always consistently good.  Delicious thick Parmesan cheese on top and tasty sauce that's not sweet or bitter.  Today, differently I tried the cheese tortilini and it was amazing.  I had the exact cheese sauce on a pasta dish some months ago at an Italian restaurant near University City.  I missed that sauce son bad although the chicken was tasteless.  Portfolio has that same sauce and the dish itself was delicious to be meatless.  The pricing was fair for what I wanted.  Next time I won't be so skeptical to try some new.

After ordering from Portofino's three times. I'm ready to review the two locations I've visited!  I've first ordered from this location but the providence location is closer to my home.  I always pleased was pleased with my meal.  The chicken Parmesan is always consistently good.  Delicious thick Parmesan cheese on top and tasty sauce that's not sweet or bitter.  Today I ordered the cheese tortilini from the providence and it was amazing.  I had the exact cheese sauce on a pasta dish some months ago at an Italian restaurant near University City.  I missed that sauce son bad although the chicken was tasteless.  Portfolio has that same sauce and the dish itself was delicious to be meatless.  The pricing was fair for what I wanted.  Next time I won't be so skeptical to try some new.  The service is quick and a good use of space inside.

Amazing food! The pasta, salads and pizzas are all fantastic. Their pizza sauce is unlike any other and the baked ziti is wonderful. Never had a bad meal, we pick up food from here once a week. Everyone is friendly and I'd definitely recommend if you're craving great Italian and can stand a busy restaurant.

Mothers Day....not the best day to judge a restaurant because of the crowds! And we had a mix up, with whether or not they take reservations or not. We were told when we called earlier in the week there was NO reservations on Mothers Day.  But the Manager was very accommodating to us and found a place for us to sit, we were divided up but we had a huge party of 12 and two high chairs. So it is GOOD Italian food, large portions but good sauce and great salads. The House Salad dressing is great, a Tomato based, with basil and garlic. Salad is full of olives and onion and cucumber, a very nice house salad. I ordered two of the Appetizer trays for the two tables. I had the Veal Parmesan, with the tomato sauce on the side. It was two nice size pieces with a large helping of Angel hair pasta with red sauce. The Veal was crisply fried with a nice amount of Mozzarella. My husband had the Manicotti but in a Alfredo Sauce, it was delicious! Some of the other family members had the Tortellini and the Chicken Picatta . They brought around a dessert tray and I ordered the Chocolate Lava cake, that is the only disappointing thing we had. It was just like a small bundt cake but not any " Lava"  in it. Service was very good and it was a huge party, that was pleasing. I have been to a couple other Portifino's and they all have been good. Oh the Calzone is huge and stuffed full of delicious ingredients, I have to get one next time I go!

Having been to the other location off Park Road I kind of knew what I was in for when coming here for lunch the other day.  This location has a rather small dining area it seemed but there is a nice patio for the better weather days if you so choose.    I ordered the chef salad and it was fantastic.  Big rolls of turkey, ham and cheese and fresh greens along with the home made ranch dressing really hit the spot.  Our waitress was nice and polite but I felt a bit rushed as I was asked if we would be having dessert and I literally hadn't even finished my salad yet.  Maybe she was in a rush to close out her lunch and leave for the day?  Either way, Portofinos is a solid selection for Italian style lunch or dinner.

Good spot, reasonably priced, casual atmosphere with really great food.   Woody at the bar is the best!! I usually grab a table with a friend, but if you are dining solo don't get take out, I mean I'm sure it's great and everything, but just grab a bar stool and enjoy your meal with some really great company.  It's like a little local spot with really friendly people a tv and a pretty extensive wine and cocktails selection.  Woody was great. Super sweet and super attentive. (He's the bartender) I mean he even refilled my cannoli because I left some shell on the plate and it obviously needs filling to be eaten   I love their linguini with clams, their  Sorrento Pasta (pomodoro with mozzarella)  And the Arriabata? I think that's what it's called? It has red sauce and mushrooms  They have great house salads and really really good bread, like really really good. It's made fresh and is always hot and delicious!!   If you save room for dessert they have the best cannolis and my new friend Deb at the bar said their tiramisu is

1) Big portions 2) Nice wine selection 3) Good service 4) Tasty food 5) friendly family style food  I have eaten all over Italy and this place wasn't close as someone else commented.  It's tasty, but a little bland.  NYC has better.  I had sausage and peppers as well as a few apps.  The seafood special was massive.  My coworker got it and it had swordfish, shrimp, mussels and clams over a half pound of linguini. He couldn't finish it.

Everything I have had at this restaurant is amazing. I love the pizza and even if it's just two of us we will get the specialty kind of pizza and split the leftovers to take home. One of my friends is addicted to their house salad dressing and they always let her have some extra to take home. Shout out to our recent server Mark! We had great service and will be back again.

Chicken Gorganzola was incredible! The salad was fresh and full of life. I think I just stumbled on the yummiest Italian in south Charlotte. Have to say the cust svc and "hostess" are not awesome so when I return it will be for takeout. But I do look forward to my return!!

Not impressed. At first I was excited that there was a Portofino's location opening up close to where I live. When I arrived, I was met with 3 unimaginative cold looking pizzas laid out close to the door exposed to the elements and the biggest black fly I've seen in a long while. That must have been one well fed and happy insect.  Anyway, I had already called ahead and ordered the vodka penne with chicken. It was gross. I don't use that word lightly. I could've done better at home. There was no flavor. There was no seasoning. The chicken tasted deliberately bland. I had even dumped a ton of Parmesan cheese in it to rescue the flavor. Nothing was helping. It wasn't cooked with love as they say. I had also ordered a slice of lemon cake. It tasted like it had been sitting in the open air all day. I didn't eat much of any of it.   I am beginning to feel that if you are not Mama Ricotta don't try making penne vodka in the Charlotte area. LOL!

The pizza sucks at this location the New York Pizza next to this place is 100 times better New York Pizza was closed on Sunday's so decided to try because of all the rave and by far worst pizza I've tried in a long time. Food specials are always over priced and don't always taste good. The Portofino's at the other location may be better I hope so.
I actually like this location better than the eastway location I love the food and the atmosphere it does get very busy here FYI

Overpriced for what you get, a clear "southern American" style of Italian food--which is to say it is greasy, over salted, and (I suspect) frozen.  1) My date and I chose the "balsamic vinaigrette" dressing with our salad, but there was no vinaigrette to it--it was pure balsamic vinegar.    2) The chicken parmigiana was overly crusty along the edges and the breading did not flake off easily--indicative of pre-pared and frozen before reheating in the kitchen.  The capellini were good, al dente.  However the breasts were EXTREMELY greasy from either excess oil or poor quality cheese on top (which by the way, was hard to discern).    3) The arrabbiate was over powered by the salt.  I understand it contains proscuitto (which is usually thin-sliced by the way, not chunky), but the salt dominates all competing flavor from the tomatoes, olives, garlic and basil.  A sure sign of poor quality food! Also, I requested broccoli with the arrabiate.  The server replied "of course."  No broccoli.  4) The cappuccino needs to be removed from the restaurant.  I understand Charlotteans are no Europeans, but the cappuccino is obviously made from instant mix.  I asked the waitress if she made it with an espresso machine and she replied "yes, we have an espresso machine."    5) The only saving grace was the bread, which was served warm and soft.  One piece of bread is too small for two people, so you have to ask for more.  I'll go to Maggiano's for future frozen Italian food, at least they have white table cloths to match the inflated menu prices.

We got pizza here last Sunday and it was dry. The onions were black. OK it happens. We called and they were going to give us a new one. When my friend went in he was extremely rude and even blamed it on us "because we took too long at Harris Teeter." First it was they left it in too long because of us. Then it was sitting out too long. Not that I need proof but I had my time stamps of all receipts and was there within the 20 minutes they told me. Never again will I go back. Things happen. I get it. Blaming it on the customer???? No thanks! I work in customer service I get how it works. We'll find a new place!
The worst Italian food I've ever had.  The lasagna I literally wouldn't feed to an animal. I'm not exaggerating.

I got their chicken parmigiana (showed picture of breaded chicken) came with chunks of chicken and tasted horrible. Called the girl was extremely rude and I asked to speak to the manager/owner... he was to busy to talk to me. Wanted to credit me $5 for my next purchase.... I'm sorry I will not ever be eating there again.... disgusted!!

A tasteless slopbucket like a soiled diaper. If you enjoy questioning the sanitation and origins of ingredients...this place has mystery! Forget TV...This place has everything!...Dirty DNA...dining tables that are never used...women over 50 in opiate recovery...cooks that use their sleeves for tissues! This food begs the question: Did I do something bad in a past life or Jesus personally...and is that my hair or a mystery chef? And someone tell them that Italian dressing isn't olive oil...food should be prepared hot...their website hours and their prices are wrong!  Never again. Go the Eagle and get a take and bake pizza....anything else is better.
One of my favorites.  I love the Tortellini Gorgonzola, however the house dressing is gross.  Service is hit or miss and manager seems like a jerk.  The food is the only reason why I return.  Period.

Best pie in Charlotte for my taste buds!  Dough is awesome, cheese is fantastic, and toppings are perfectly balanced around the pizza. Price is awesome too!!!  Thanks for putting out a high quality and consistent product.  There other menu items are great as well.  You should do yourself a favor and try this place out!

There aren't many Italian restraurants that I have been to in the area, probably because when I get a craving I always come here. The food and service are good, the portion sizes are large and the prices are fair. I usually order a seafood pasta dish but dinning with friends I have never heard a complaint about any of their dishes.
Great spot! Family friendly, amazing service, massive portions and outstanding sauce!  You gotta try the Affettato!

Great food and the staff was very attentive. The seating is a bit congested, but otherwise this place is awesome! We had the white pizza, eggplant parmesan, chicken parmesan, house salad, lasagna and a seafood pasta dish. All the meals were delicious and served hot from the oven. We had to wait a bit for the lasagna to finish cooking, but it was well worth the wait and the wine calmed our impatience.
One of the very best Italian places in charlotte - highly recommend the pasta sorrento. Comes with salad so lots to wait for

I love so close and noticed how busy they always are. Unfortunately my experience was not so great  The wait person left us with no drink refills And I had to get someone else to find him to get me ticket to pay. Pretty sad when they were not that busy

Simple, well made pizza and other typical pizzeria fair.   Portions of the pizzas are sadly not justified by their price. Too many nights ordering from Portos dropping over $15 and still hungry.   Perfect portions for lunches.

I've been to this place once to get a gyro,my husband took me there since it's near our place of business. So it was Saturday night and me and my daughter were hanging out at our shop,I figured getting a pizza would be nice for late snacks.  So let me start with my order taker,my order taker wasn't really that pleasant,I got this impression that it's like you're bothering them by calling them for delivery,I was ready to just hangup and call another place but I tried to remain calm so I ordered medium Hawaiian,fries and 6 pc wings. When I received my delivery,I got a cheese pizza instead,no pineapple and ham. I was disappointed but oh well. They gave me 7 pc wings instead of 6 probably to make up for the mistake idk.   The positive side is I love the wings and the fries,and above all,my picky eater toddler loved the fries and the garlic parm wings. The delivery guy was nice too and I got my order in less than 30 mins.   I will probably order from them again,they just need to step up their customer service.

Meh. Portofino's is fine--nothing over the top special, though. It's not bad, certainlly, but there's nothing about it that really distinguishes it from a standard Italian restaurant. But that's a pitfall that a lot of italian places can't avoid, so I don't really get upset.   Big, heaping servings, which is always a plus. Fast, attentive service--definitely a plus. And everyone there was pretty friendly.   Pretty packed though, so be wary of that--and lots of corporate diners, so it wasnt exactly a mellow experience in that regard. I'll be back, but I won't exactly be ushering friends here. Or you.

The food was four stars, a few other factors lowered it to three.  First the good: the pizza was excellent. We got the montese which had prosciutto, basil, and mushrooms. The saltiness of the proscuitto complimented the sweetness of their pizza sauce. The crust was very good. Excellent pizza. I'm a sauce and crust curmudgeon and they scored very high with both!  My wife and daughter split a kids style penne with butter and my wife said the pasta was al dente... cooked nicely. The salad and bread were also good.  Now the bad: first off, this is not a paper plate take out joint. There are near $20 entrees on the menu. That being said, there is no excuse for the servers not offering freshly grated parmesan at your table. They have packets of US Foods pseudo saw dust cheese and stuff out of the shaker which is US Foods pseudo saw dust cheese. Our server finally brought shaved fresh parmesan from the kitchen on attempt number three. So, there are fresh chunks of parmesan available.. why the fork is it not offered by the servers? Throw in the fact our service was slow and often inaccurate, that is why this is a three star review.  So, food good! Service and intangibles, meh. We will eat there again when in the area, but we will be well armed to know to ask for shaved parmesan.

LOVE this place! If you're looking for authentic Italian look no further. The pizza is awesome, cheesesteaks are great and the pasta is to die for. My favorite is Shrimp Fra Diavolo with a spicy pink sauce. I have been going since 2003 and have yet to be disappointed in any location.

This is my go-to neighborhood joint for solid Italian food when I'm in Charlotte. The pizza is good and the pasta dishes are delicious and reliable, especially the basics like spaghetti and meat sauce and the chicken Parmesan. Take out or dine in, you won't be disappointed.

I love this place ! We have had the pizza, which is amazing they make sure to take care of you lots of cheese, lots of pepperoni, ect.  Gyros are amazing. Haven't had one that i wasn't satisfied with they pack in the meat and its real gyro meat not the kind that looks shaved.  Wings are super meaty ! Not little and stingy! I suggest that you go here for a quick cheap meal.

Walked away disappointed. Thought I was going to get the whole Italian experience but yet it's that "New York" Italian kinda place.  I have discovered I don't like NY style pizza- crust on pizza should be crisp & I hold it's shape- chewy doughy crust is gross in my humble opinion- but thats just the southern in me.  Anyway onto the experience: 3 stars- Were immediately greeted. the restaurant is nicely decorated although I felt teh entrance was to cluttered and a little boxed in. teh girl who seated us had a half smile and although was very nice and seated us in a decent place she just didnt seem geniunely pleased to be there.  2 stars- Our waitress came right over and greeted us and let us know she would be right back to get our drink order. When she came and we all ordered water with lemon she seemed a little irritated that we did not order something charge worthy.   3 stars- We pondered over the menu trying to deciede if we were all going to get a pizza or order entrees. So while ponderig some more we order the Calamari- I am a huge fan of calamari and have eaten it in every place that offers it. Next she brings the bread basket and plates. there is no traditional oil and vinegar on the table so we asked for it. but discovered later that there was little butters in the bottom of the basket- nice to know once we almost finshed the bread.  2 stars- calamari comes and is enough for 2 but not 3 people. the breading was light and very bland! no seasoning AT ALL. the ring parts were super chewy! either old or previously frozen or maybe just over cooked. we added lemon to it that didnt help enough but adding salt did help a littlebit. the marinara itself was just fine- although olvies gross me out andi have a huge tomato end piece that was a little green. i also added a bit of red pepper flakes to the marinara which seemed to improve it! and I ate it on my bread so the marinara gets 3 stars!  3 stars- we ordered the montese pizza. now ive had proscuitto before but there was just something strange about this. it was sour tasting and EXTREMELY salty and very tough. i dont kno if it was the brand or not sliced thin enough or maybe have 3 slices together on each pizza slice or maybe every being baked made it so unappetizing. i only ate one piece of pizza. the 3 stars is only because hubby and daughter liked it ok, but were not jazzed about it.  overall experience is a 3 i guess. lets just say I was so hoping for the authentic flavors I would get when at my Italian (not a NEW YORK ONE but the real deal who barely spoke English and was here from Naples Italy about 2 years before opening his on place) brother in laws restaurant back in the 90's near my hometown.  dont know if we will return but definately wont get the pizza next time

It's probably not completely fair to review a restaurant based on a take-out experience alone, but considering my take-out experience was a good one, I figured it was ok!  Craving some Italian food last night, but not wanting to bother with changing clothes, dealing with the Saturday night wait times, and sitting in a restaurant for hour or so, I used the search features on Yelp to help me find Portofinos.  They have a specific take-out menu online, so I figured that was a good sign that getting food to-go was an acceptable option here. The guy who took my phone order was friendly & efficient & recommended the house dressing for my salad (it was yummy!)  You pick up your food right inside the front door. I saw some pretty tasty looking pizzas being boxed up. And based on other Yelp reviews, I'll have to give that a try next time.  I got a ton of food! A generous side salad with decent toppings (tomatoes, cucumbers, carrots & olives; no cheese & no croutons, which is perfect for me). The chicken parmesan was great. Just what I was craving. It came with a large side of angel hair pasta & sauce. I had plenty for last night's dinner & enough for today's lunch.  If a restaurant can pull off a successful take-out dinner, I suspect dining in here would be equally good. I don't splurge on Italian food very often (lots of calories for this health nut!), but Portofinos will now be on my short list of south Charlotte restaurants to revisit.

This is one of the two better locations of the local Portofino's chain.  It's a nicely laid out and nicely decorated with an Italian village style (go figure!).    The food is consistently good here whether it's the lasagna, pizza or salad and they have a decent wine selection.  And I LOVE their house salad dressing here...here's a tomato based creamy Italian.  It's also good as a dipping sauce on the bread.  The only thing I didn't like is the servers seemed to be hawking over you in this location.  But the last time I was there, they weren't that busy so maybe they were looking for something to do.

The food has always been good especially the bolognese and lasagna.  Salads are good also.  Cheese steaks are awesome!  Only complaint I have is the service is not consistent.  I have had good ones and bad ones.  Most of the bad ones just needed more training.  This is not the kind of place for teenage servers.  Most are not familiar with the food.  I also recommend that you come early or later or your gonna wait.  It's is smaller than the Park Rd location and if you show up at peak time, you're gonna wait so expect it.  The restaurant needs to be larger to serve more guests.
Best Pizza in town!  Everything is really great.  Portions are HUGE...good to split or have great leftovers.  The house dressing is totally addictive.
Best marina sauce around.  nice patio seating.  great for quick lunch as well as casual dinners.

They only take reservations for parties of 6 or more which was fine.  We went on a Thursday night and while they were busy, we got right in at 8pm.  Don't worry that this is in a strip shopping area & if it's a nice evening sit on the patio!  Oh, we were oh so happy here!  Italian food is a staple for us like so many people and thank you Yelp community for all the reviews.  I really enjoy finding new restaurants & places to go through Yelp!  We sat on the patio...it's right off the parking lot, but they've really insulated it from most noises with the landscaping & you rarely even notice anyone walking by and we sat on the side closest to parking!  The patio is quiet, cozy & intimate with a fountain that adds a wonderful ambiance.  (I will make a quick note here to parents...please....restaurants are not places for your children to explore/play in)  The pasta dishes: Boscaiola 11.95 With prosciutto bits and fresh peas in a creamy pink sauce, wonderfully smoky and the Linguini was perfectly cooked and the Chicken Gorgonzola 15.95 Chicken breast saut√©ed with garlic and mushrooms in gorgonzola cream sauce...YUMMY!  My sweetie doesn't like gorgonzola, but it was done so well with a light touch that he enjoyed a bit or two!  It was nice they brought around the dessert tray for us to see!  We chose to split the Italian Rum Cake!  It is served chilled and it was a light and lightly sweet, wonderful end to the meal.  I didn't realize there were 4 of these restaurants in town... but I'm not surprised!  Our server was Sophia and she was just wonderfully friendly and bright and charming...she's a keeper!

I never have had a bad experience here.  I usually get my food to go.  I really enjoy the generous portions of cheese with any noodle based dish.  This is also my favorite Americanized Italian food.  I used to live in Buffalo and this food reminds me of that place.  Robust flavors, robust portions, reasonable prices.  I don't think you can go wrong here no matter what you order.  I stick to the lasagna, Alfredo, and baked Ziti.

Portofino's is one of my favorite in Charlotte.  Good NY style pizza is always a hit, but the real draw is the amazing homemade style sauces used for their various pasta and other Italian dishes.  My favorite dish is their Chicken Parm.  The dining area is small and a bit cramped and the wait for a table during dinner can be long, but once seated the service is fine and you can also call ahead as their take out service is efficient and the prices are reasonable.  Based on multiple visits and take out orders.

This is my favorite local Pizza! Fast, hot, and delicious.   They have some small seating areas but I have never utilized them, I mostly pick up from the counter or opt for delivery, which are usually very quick!  I also appreciate that they now have online ordering. I have ordered pizza for both pickup and delivery via the website, at times where it was not possible or convenient to use the phone. It's a great feature that I'm glad they've added.

This is one of my several times at a Portofino's. My boyfriend and I decided to go here for our date night, since I haven't been to this location before. Plus, we love going to new restaurants. The outside of the building looks very nice, but it is very crammed once you go inside. There is hardly any room, especially when there are multiple people standing around waiting. I did love that you could see them baking the pizza's though, I always love to watch stuff like that. However, the hostess was pretty rude. I didn't appreciate that all too much.  We had a pretty good seat once we got placed, and our waitress was extremely friendly. It did take a long time though just to be able to get our drinks, salads, and the bread however. But it was worth the wait, they were simply delicious. I ordered the Penne Pomodoro, and it wasn't at all what I was expecting. I didn't like it too much. Overall, we had a pretty good experience. Hardly any wait, and the food was pretty standard. A little pricey though.
I LOVE this place! This is the best Pizza in Pittsburgh, hands-down.   XL Mushrooms, Anchovies & Black Olives!   My only complaint is that they don't deliver to Brighton Heights. Why did I move??
Portofinos is so good. I've gone there 3 times this week. I have fallen in love with in there bolognaise.

Since the first day Portofino has opened its doors, I got to eat there 3 times. First 2 times I went by myself. It went pretty smooth, good food and training staff, no problem. On my last visit on this past Sunday I took my wife, my son and my friend whose visiting out of town to here. My wife has celiac. She called ahead to make sure that they serve something gluten free.  She got the gluten free bolognese pasta. We triple asked the servers to make sure it's gluten free. They all said yes. I tasted the GF pasta which tasted just like regular pasta but staff said it's GF. So she ate it.  She's been having stomach cramps and all her system is screwed up now. What she ate wasn't GF, they served regular penne pasta to her.   Even though my experience was decent this visit ruined it for us.

Portofinos is one of my favorite Italian restaurants in the Charlotte area.    There are multiple locations.  The Park Road location has indoor seating and a really nice outdoor patio.  I went with my father-in-law and husband after the PGA championship.  We ordered a meat and cheese plate for appetizer, the chicken fettuccine to split, and my father in law got the veal marsala.  Our service was excellent and so was all of our food!  Our waitress brought out bread, vinegar, and oil to start.  We will always come back to portofinos!

My family and I came in here for dinner today. Our waitress was a latino woman in her late 40s. She was very bland, did not introduce herself, and when I asked for recommendations as I've never ate there, she acted like she didn't know what I was saying. Then, we noticed after she took our order that our food was supposed to come with a side. She never offered a side nor did she show the sides. We ordered a small pizza for the kids, chicken marsala, and piccante. The food took about an hour to come out so we asked for it to go. When I got home to eat, the meals lacked flavor and our marsala and piccante were so dry that you could eat it with the noodles. I will NEVER go back. A total waste of $47!
