The best Italian in Charlotte.  Period.  I have been going there on Sunday night for 20 years.  The food, the people and the ambience cannot be replaced by any other restaurant I have ever frequented.
Great fresh food and nice environment. Clean and waiter was very attentive. Highly recommended. Will definitely be back!

We went to the location at Arboretum on Friday at around 8:00. We were able to walk right in and get a seat. There were a lot of choices on the menu. We tried a tomato garlic salad dressing upon our waiter's suggestion and it was pretty good. We also tried the house Italian dressing which I found to have a distinct olive flavor to it which I didn't care much for - I don't like olives but usually this is not a problem with other dressings. We got hot bread included which was good - it was soft - very much like a Pillsbury french bread roll. For the entrees I got the Pasta Sorrento and he got the Veal Parmigiana. I liked my dish - he loved his. The portions were large - we both had about half of our food leftover. Overall, the service was very good and the food was good. I would not say that this is my favorite Italian restaurant but it I did like it.

Authentic, tasty and hearty Italian cookin that even my wonderful, Italian grandma wouldn't mind diving into - and that's saying a lot. Yes, my grandmother is one of the best cooks in the world (major bias, I'm sure) but Portofino's throws down some damn tasty eats.  I stopped by Portofino's to catch up with a friend over a casual lunch. While their menu looked pretty enticing I went with their lunch special "bake": two jumbo stuffed shells, one manicotti, baked and covered in meat sauce. While I can't get grandma's cookin' in Charlotte, this was a very solid substitute! The shells and manicotti were perfectly cooked (not overly so) and stuffed with delicious ricotta. And the sauce - purty tasty too - although I would have been delighted with another manicotti and less sauce. But that's just personal preference!  The service was friendly and attentive and I never went without at least a half-full beverage. Plus, the prices are pretty affordable - my bake was $7.95. Not bad! I absolutely want to come back and try their 'za and maybe a whole tray of desserts. Nom!

$9 for a delicious grilled chicken salad. Flavorful and healthy! Comes with marinated vegetables on top! Fresh homemade ranch. Small loaf of bread included. Owners are super sweet!!! Takeout ready in 10 minutes. Gladly support this business!

Wow the best calamari I believe I've ever had. Perfectly seasoned. I didn't need hot sauce or anything. I don't eat marinara but I did try it and it was ok.  The bread they serve you is great. Crusty on the outside soft on the inside. For my birthday lunch I got linguine and clams in a white wine sauce. Different from any white wine sauce I've ever had but delicious. Will bring my husband back to try some pizza.

This is now the main pie shop I order from since I moved over here. Their Buffalo Chicken Pizza is soooo awesome. I have since also tried all the styles of pie and they are all pretty good. I'm not a fan of Chicago Style but, eat some tums and we're good to go . . ha

We have been patron of this restaurant for 20 years. We dined Sunday night 12/11 for my husbands birthday. We cannot believe the reduced portion sizes. The food is still delicious but the baked pasta dish portions have been cut in half recently. What a disappointment.

I have discovered Portofinos after a coworker got some takeout for lunch.  I have been there three times in three days!   Having grown up in the Philadelphia suburbs, I know what it takes to be a good cheesesteak.  The closest I've ever come was Jersey Mike's, but their cheesesteaks are only meh.  Here, I can order one just like I did back home - a large cheesesteak with mushrooms and pizza sauce.  The rolls are just as good as Amarosos, the amount of steak is very close to what you'd get in Philly, and the cheese, mushrooms, and sauce are enough to complement without overtaking the steak.  By far, the best I've had outside of home.  I can already tell this is going to be a dangerous place for me!  I need to hit the gym twice as hard if I'm going to eat there more often.
Small location and packed! They make me off the menu linguine and broccoli and it is possibly the best I've ever had! Don't forget to check out the awesome specials

I went here for dinner last night and was excited to try it after it had been recommended to me. I ordered the chicken parmesan and it was okay. The chicken tasted like it wasn't seasoned at all. It was mostly cheese and breading and very little chicken. The sauce was also very acidic and salty and lacking in flavor. It tasted like it was just pur√©ed tomatoes and salt. The salad and Italian dressing that I had with my meal was also unappealing. Our service was also very slow and they got a few orders wrong at our table.

Canned mushrooms on a pizza? Seriously?  Hello Potifino's....1980 called and wants their canned ingredients back.  We scraped the garbage toppings off the pizza only to find poor quality cheese, sauce (probably prepackaged as well) and tasteless dough.   Was really hoping for better considering the wait line on a Saturday night. More proof that food sucks outside Charlotte. If this place was near competition it would go out of business quickly.
Out of this world!  Superb!  The food was excellent, atmosphere friendly and workers very time efficient.

Nice place.  I've been twice, and the food is always good. The atmosphere is nice, too.  However, this time, there were supplies all over the place, as if they ran out of room or something.  I stared at two spray bottles of cleaner on the half-wall beside our table the entire time.  Kinda weird. The italian dishes are great, and they always have a few specials that are not Italian (steak, fish, etc.).  The prices are reasonable, too.   Their wine selection isn't the best, but it's not awful, and they're not marking the wine up 400% like most restaurants, either. The few times per year that I'm in the mood for Italian, Portofino's will definitely be in my top two choices.

The food here us not bad and we use to come here with a certain frequency. Tiday was an awful service experience, with an disinterested waiter, who barely knew the menu. 15 minutes to tell us that the pizza I ordered can't be done how I ordered it is not cool and very disappointing. Here's hoping for a better experience to others who venture here.

I had Zuppa de Pex and it was superb! Great Italian bread served with seasoned olive oil and balsamic...  Bobby had the chicken Parmesan and said the chicken was moist and tender with a light crust and excellent marinara.

The husband and I went here last night for dinner. We shared the large antipasti salad, the shrimp scampi pasta, and the clams casino. All were excellent and we left very happy. The house dressing is awesome...Not sure if I want to know what's in it, it's so good :) Service was very attentive. Food came out quick and food and wine prices are reasonable. What else can you ask for?? Definitely give it a try

Yeah, their pizza is pretty friggin' good.  Came here after a round of golf and it was the best food ever.  Shared a large margherita(sp?) pizza and it was cooked to perfection.  Mozarella was melted evenly and tasted very good.  The tomato slices on top were not too thick nor too thin.  Bartender was attentive and made sure to refill our drinks.   Place looked busy and understandably so.  I'm sleepy--hopefully I dream of this place!  dmo out.
Great pizza, subs and even salads. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The wait time on the weekends can be a little bit insane though.

This is by far my favorite Italian restaurant in Charlotte! From the bread, to the salad, entrees, pizza - the best! Service is consistently good and the prices are very reasonable. I'm from NJ where there are good, authentic Italian restaurant on every corner and Portofino's definitely measures up.

I am so disappointed.  Have ordered from here for years.  Used to be very good pizza.  Not today.  Maybe new management???  We were quoted 40-45 minutes for delivery.  I called after more than an hour and was told it was on  its way. Promised it was going to be hot since it was in the delivery bag.  After another 15 minutes (I only live 7 minutes from the store) I called again.  I asked for a credit or something since the rest of our dinner was getting cold.  The woman who claimed to be the owner/manager said she could only give me money back if I refuse the order.  She said it was not her fault and threw her driver under the bus.  She said If we eat it, full price.  When it arrived the pizza was NOT delivery bag and it was cold.  Will never order from here again -- too many other places to get good pizza for good price in good time.

Average food at decent prices. I can't speak for the Italian entrees, which they looked good. We had the pizza and a cheesesteak.  Pizza sauce was a little bland. NY style, fold over pizza. Cheesesteak was OK, nothing special. I would return to try some of the pastas. The service was excellent.

Store front restaurant is small, casual and usually crowded. We ordered the cheese garlic bread for an appetizer and it was huge!  Also, the Italian Wedding soup with  lots of meatballs in chicken broth.   I had Chicken Sorrento with gluten free pasta.  Chicken was tender with eggplant, peas, tomatoes covered with cheese.   The wait staff was attentive, smelled awesome and the place was clean.

My boss' favorite Italian restaurant when he travels here. We even had our sales meeting here and were very well treated. We sat at the tables outside and were treated to great wine, fresh tasting food, and delicious salads.   My only mediocre note was the dessert-but we really didn't have much room anyway!

I heard coworkers say it's such a great Italian restaurant but I'm not impressed , the flavor was lacking and the pasta was definitely not fresh . The service gave this Italian spot 2stars . My family wanted to ask for ketchup for their sauces :( . Well , maybe the pizza is good ?
Awesome family spot. Great Italian dishes. Always fresh and delicious. It all starts with a good red sauce.

LOVE. Portofino.  The Italian food is by far the best I've had in charlotte.  I know nothing of it's history, but I know the owner is from Italy and I can tell.  Several Italians were dining with us and it was really cool to see.    I ordered the Mediterano and hubs ordered the gorgonzola tortellini. Both were excellent and came out hot.  Portion sizes are huge and the flavor is oh so good.  Catering and take out are also available.
The best Italian in charlotte! Their house dressing is good, but their lasagna is to die for!!!!!!

Their spinach and feta white pizza is amazing, I've been ordering it from them for at least a decade.  Truly awesome.  Everything else is above average, but the white pizza really is the best thing on the menu.  yum!

Portofino's really hit the spot last night. I was craving some good italian, and not just pizza.  Don't be fooled by the shopping center, the place is quite spacious and they have a lovely patio. After some wine and chatting at a friend's house, we headed over to Portofino's for a late dinner. It was perfect, because when we got there, there was no wait and the weather was perfect for dinner on the patio (although it was a bit dark, they could use a couple more patio lights).  Our server was friendly and attentive. He gave us some time to look over the menus and didn't rush us. The menu is pretty diverse, with all kinds of options, and I definitely had trouble narrowing it down (I knew I wanted pasta, but wasn't sure what kind of sauce, all the choices looked great!). I finally just asked him for a recommendation, and he recommended the bascaiola. It sounded great and I couldn't make up my mind, so I ran with that (on top of penne). The restaurant was also super accommodating to my friend who is gluten free, and made her a special risotto (the special of the day was a veal risotto and she didn't want veal, so they took their chicken sorrento and subbed risotto for capelleni).   Our meals came with bread basket and salad. The salad was basic, and was the perfect size for a starter (a tad too many carrots). The bread was warm and crusty. My pasta was delicious; the sauce had great flavor, there was a ton of prosciutto and peas, and the serving was huge. I actually just ate some of the leftovers for lunch, and it was still just as good the next day!  I'm definitely adding Portofino's to my go-to list.

I have never been to this location before and I liked it.  The inside was very cozy and inviting.  The hostess greeted us right away and there was no wait.  The waitress was just wonderful!  She was attentive and helpful throughout the entire meal.  I ordered what I always get from their Eastway location: fettuccini with spicy marinara!  I'm a little boring, I know...but it's just so good.  I love spicy food and this sauce is great.  It tasted even better than the other location, more fresh.  The food came out quickly and I have no complaints!  I would love to come back when I am on the area.

Well, I had ordered from Portofino's since I received one of their menus in the mail.  I'm new to the Crafton area so finding my go to pizza place is a must.  I try to find the best of the best wherever I go so when I moved to Crafton, the search was on.  I had tried a couple places before discovering Portofino's...I didn't realize they were the place I had passed by many times prior to moving here...very convenient spot off Steuben St.  So, when I got the menu in the mail, I decided to try it.  I ordered an Antipasto Salad, which I've grown very fond of...it's the ham, salami And cheese that bring it over the top.  I had gotten the pretzel bites, which, for the price were a little short on size and portion...but good.  I had gone to Supremo's Pizzeria in Ross Twp, and their pretzel bites are, sorry to say, better.  But I ordered a hot Italian hoagie which the bread was crisp on the outside but soft on the inside, with a good portion of meats and cheese.  I ordered a pizza too and actually was very happy with the size and portion.  The toppings were plenty and the crust was crisp and not droopy like some other places.  The only disappointment was that my most recent order, I ordered a bottle of Diet Coke, and t didn't come with my order...can't eat pizza without a soda (pop).  I can't bring myself to call it pop...I'm not from Pittsburgh originally, so I call it soda.  Crafton has a several choices for pizza, but do give this place a try...I like it...

Solid Portofino Pie. Not the best in town - and nowhere near the worst. But I like my 'fino's better.  Something about this super-clean Tuscan decor job, complete with painterly mural work, foliage-a-dangling, and faux columns in awkward places (not unlike the Eastway outpost) is amusing when it's in one of the most thug life strip malls in town. When it's part of this newfangled City Square stuff it just boils over into pretentious-ville.    Pie is good, tho.

Portofino's is decent place to go - once. I liked their pasta and the service was decent although the waitress could not understand most of what I asked and I couldn't understand most of what she said. But she was trying hard to make sure we were okay and that was nice. This place is over priced for the food quality and the menu which is pretty basic. If you're looking for value for money  I would look elsewhere.  I might go get their pasta again but not any time soon. I dont like places that try to be upscale but end up being only high end in their prices while the food quality and menu innovation remain stagnant.
We recently moved to Charlotte, and so far this is the most authentic Italian food we found around. Me and my hubby we eat at this location at least twice at week, love it .

There was a bit of a wait on a Friday night which was unexpected because I didn't think they received so much business. Now, I know why! Excellent service, flavorful food, and gigantic proportions. I had enough food for dinner that night, lunch the next day and dinner again! Great value for the price.

Disappointing. We drove 30 minutes out of the way for a good lunch, but it wasn't a good lunch. Problems:  - Very small portion for Chicken parmigiana - Very cold and dark in front room (we don't know why they put us in this room, or why they didn't turn the lights on) - Waiter was decent at service but looked unhappy to be there - Waitress tried to help stack plates at end of meal, which was a nice gesture but she stalked every single plate right at the edge of the table less than an inch from my lap (it was awkward) - Pizza was average at best. Nothing special it all in regards to flavor or crust  Good Points:  - Bread with butter

I went here for lunch this past week and had a pasta with grilled salmon. It was incredible! My friend had a Philly cheesesteak and it looked so good. It was my first time and I ant wait to try more menu items.

Get a pizza maybe other wise hang it up the place claims to have Italian food, please.  Bartender is a pretentious prick and the entre's are way over priced and trust they all taste the same. Never again!

The penne ala vodka, though not on the menu is not disappointing and the tiramisu is one of the biggest portions of dessert I've ever seen. The atmosphere is nice and the food is very good although I would've liked more than one breast in my chicken parm. Their red sauce though, which is as important as anything at an Italian restaurant, is very very good.
Their pizza is great. I lived in NYC and have also spent a good amount of time in Italy. I feel I can be the judge of a damn good pizza now.

I must say, we found this place last minute, and I'm glad we did. The location was very nice looking, in a fancy Harris Teeter anchored shopping center.  There were a lot of people there and that really added to the atmosphere.  Our server was awesome.  He was a super nice guy, had the authentic Italian accent, and was on it all night.  We began our meal with plenty of delicious wine, alongside a a plate of fried calamari.  It was a little bit undercooked and under seasoned for me.   I opted for the special, the surf n turf.  The lobster tail was cooked perfectly.  It was so so good.  I haven't had that good of lobster in a long time.  It came with a ribeye steak, which was cooked great also.  The only down side for me was that it was probably only a 1/2 inch steak.  When I get a steak, I want thickness.  It's the only way to get that beautiful chargrilled outside with that perfect pink inside.  I would definitely recommend this one to friends.  My one caveat was the drive, so next go around I think I'm definitely going to have to check out the original location, off of eastway.  Originals are always the best.  Am I right?

Well helllllo Italian delight!!  This place knows what they are doing when it comes to the lunch-size cheese steaks.  I can't attest to the dinner platters just yet, but this is a definite place to stop for a semi quick lunch.  I had the 11 inch cheese steak with onions and it was superb.  Like most sandwiches, the bread is what makes the difference.  It was right on point and perfectly toasted.  Give it a try and you will not be disappointed.    PS.  I just started at a new job and my co-workers thought they would haze me.  They forced me to finish the massive cheese steak in one sitting.  Little did they know, like the cow, I have a four chamber stomach and threw down that sandwich with some fries.  They brought their halves home in a doggy bag.  Enormous portion size!  Thanks Brad/Seth.  Enjoy..     -Ian M.

I've eaten here probably 5 times at this point, maybe more. The people here are very friendly and the food is good. I've had pasta and pizza dishes. All very good! Today I ordered the baked ziti. As usual it was very good. My only complaint, and it's minor, is that the red sauce is sweet. I wish they'd temper it a little more. Always worth a visit.

Last night after driving 4 hours with a 1 yr old. Then dinner, her & I both agree the chicken sorrento was absolutely fabulous. The serving size is perfect, enough to fill up up & then some to marinate over night for the next day. I can hardly wait. And my wife equally enjoyed her dinner, but I can't remember what she got & I'm not going to wake her up to ask. ; )
Food was excellent here. Kids loved the pasta and the garlic bread. I enjoyed the pizza (and this is coming from a NYer).

We were celebrating my Daughter being selected as the Teacher of the year for Charlotte Mecklenburg school district so there were 15 people in our group.  After the awards ceremony we headed to Portofino's without a reservation.  It was crowded but we were seated promptly on the front porch. The wait staff worked with us to seat our party of 15! They quickly pushed tables together and directed us how to sit so that everyone was together.  It was tight but we were delighted to all sit together.    Our dinner orders were taken quickly by a very patient and professional server who got every order right the first time!  He quickly rolled off the list of specials and seeing the size of our group offered us the lunch menu which contained more sandwiches.  All of the food ordered arrived together and the presentation was appetizing.  I wanted to try everybody's food but just asked for a thumbs up from our group.  All 15 gave their food two thumbs up.  My daughter had the Cheese Steak from the lunch menu.  You can customize your steak sandwich about 7 different ways and there are a number of subs, cold sandwiches, baked dishes, fish etc.  I can't wait to come back for lunch.  I had the Grilled Salmon Salad for $11.95.  It comes with mixed greens topped with grilled salmon and marinated vegetables.  The salmon was cooked perfectly, moist but seared.  You can't go wrong with a basic salmon salad at this point if your salad greens are fresh and your dressing is delicious. Score for Portofino's on both!  My husband had the same salad with Grilled Chicken.  He says the  chicken was very moist and well seasoned.   To top it off at the end of the meal the servers brought my daughter a Tiramisu with a candle to celebrate her accomplishments.  It was a delightful experience and I will definitely be back to visit one of the three locations in Charlotte.

Last night was my first time at Portofino's. I ordered the Chicken Tarantino, it came out looking pretty good but when I bit into the chicken it was bland and on the dry side. My wife ordered Gorgonzola Chicken which was probably the best dish at the table but still sub par to what I've had in the past. The waiter kindly asked the chef to make Chicken Francese for my daughter (it's her favorite food) which they kindly agreed to do but unfortunately it came out extremely dry and didn't taste anything like Chicken Francese other than someone squeezing some lemon juice over the top of it. My daughter who normally eats two servings at home took only a single bite and didn't touch it again. I'm hoping I had a bad experience as the service was delightful and the atmosphere of the restaurant was great but the food was not anywhere close to being as good as I expected.

Portofino's is definitely the neighborhood Italian go to for us! My boyfriend and I have gone here several times and it never fails to please. It is the type of Italian food that both Italians and non-Italians will appreciate because of the genuine taste. I'm very particular about my Italian food (because no ones ever beats my mother and grandmother's cooking) but they have the foundation of great food starting with their gravy (red sauce), warm atmosphere, and the generous portions they give you.  Every time I come to Portofino's I get the eggplant parm (since it is one of my favorite dishes) and a Lady Cello cocktail. I can rarely finish the entire entree in one sitting, and if I do I need to practically be rolled out. I am pretty sure they use an entire eggplant and marry it with gravy and cheese galore. Talking about this makes me want to sneak to the fridge and take out my leftovers.... ;)   Though I stick to my tried and true eggplant parm, my boyfriend has worked his way through at least half of the menu at this point and it has all been great. His personal favorite is the shrimp parm. You will always get freshly baked bread with your meal and a lot of dishes come with a  side salad, and for that I totally suggest the house dressing!!   The environment is always casual and laid back. Some nights the dinner rush causes a bit of a wait, especially on the weekends, but we have never had to wait too exceptionally long. The service is not always five star but we have never had any significant issues and everyone has always been friendly. The quality of the Italian feast you get makes up for the sometimes slow service.   Know going in that this is not a high dollar environment and they are not aiming to wow you with white linens and crystal, however they do want you to get a real feel of what Italian food can truly bring you: an insanely full stomach, comfort, warmth, wine, cocktails, laughs, and a casual place to enjoy your family and friends. That's what Italians are all about. :) Try it out!

Been a long time since we went to a Portofino's because there wasn't one close to us. Now that there is, we were excited. To be fair, we didn't eat a wide variety. We had the Stromboli and salad and the wife and I split it. We thought it was very good. Would suggest the salad be served on a cold plate but other than that, what we had was good.  Service was good - not stellar but also training people at the time.

Our table had the Chicken Sorrento, Stuffed Eggplant, and Margherita Pizza. The chicken was super tender and delicious, the eggplant was a tasty way to get in some veggies, and the pizza was just the right amount of crispy and chewy. Our waiter, Gary, was fun, attentive and helpful. Thanks for a very enjoyable experience.   One note about parking: during busy times, parking can be tough because the small lot serves lots of businesses. It's worth a little bit of frustration, though, so just wait for someone to leave the grocery store and take their spot!

Good food and service--Italian, pretty straight forward and nothing to really stand out.  The portions are decent and the price is good.  They did offer several specials., but we went with the standard lasagna and chicken parmesan.  One thing I liked is the entrees come with a side salad and plenty of bread. We brought our own wine, and thy do charge a $9 cork fee, which is better than most places.  My dining companion remembered the place as being cozier, but the lights are pretty bright.  Dim the lights and maybe some candles.  Good food, but not sure if warrants another visit.

The food was great. I ordered the shrimp scampi pasta other guest in my party ordered the shrimp parm, chicken portofino, chicken parm, and a pasta dish. Our service wasn't really there I've had better but I'll definitely return when I'm in the Charlotte area
Delicious Italian food. Great pizzas and good tortellini Alfredo! Family atmosphere and good wait staff.

We where in the mood for Italian. You know the place is good when you don't understand half the menu. Rated it 4 start because the menu is a bit confusing as in what the Italian names mean, like your not sure what kind of dish it is.

Their food quality has gone down and their prices have gone up. The people who work here are not very friendly and seem annoyed to help you.    The positive is they usually deliver your food there in a half hour or less unless you order on a Friday or Saturday then it's closer to an hour.   I wouldn't recommend ordering online due to all of the issues they've had with their online ordering software. We were recently double charged and were given a hard time by Portofino's staff. They were not helpful and dismissed it.   All around just a poor way to do business and unfortunately lackluster food.

Went to Portofino's for lunch with a few coworkers and we all enjoyed our meals and experience!  We got there at about 11:45 and I'm glad we did, because as we were leaving there was a line out the door... That must say something for this restaurant!  The sever was really quick to get our drink order and to take our meal order once she brought our drinks.  She told us about three lunch specials that all sounded delicious but I decided to order off the menu.  I ordered a side salad to start out with Witt he house dressing and the shrimp scampi for my meal.  One of my coworkers ordered the chicken and vegetable lasagne that was one of the lunch specials and my other co- worker ordered the linguine pasta with arrabbiata sauce.    Our side salads were delicious and very fresh!  I loved that they put green olives on the salad...different but good (if you like olives)!  The house dressing is really good and tastes even better with the warm bread they bring with your meal!  The shrimp scampi was probably some of the best I've ever had!  I chose the linguine as my pasta choice and it was perfectly al dente!  The shrimp were huge and fresh!  I could only eat half my meal and it was still good the next day reheated!  My coworker offered me a bite of his lasagna...now I see what everyone was talking about in the previous reviews!  Amazing!  It must be on special a lot and I could see why!  My other coworker enjoyed his dish as well (he ate it too fast for me to swipe a bite)!  All in all I love Portofino's and can't wait to go back again!!

Tried to order 2 hoagie special at 7:45 pm and was called back shortly after by a very sweet young lady by the name of Kelly and informed they were out of Hoagies and had one left?? Ok first thing i wanted to ask was how do you run out of your 2nd most popular item?? But my wife was ok if they replaced with a meatball calzone. Phoned back and my wife was greeted by a very rude man whose name we didnt catch. She informed him that the meatball calzone and the one hoagie would be fine. He proceeded to argue with her and told her that it would cost more than our original order for that one item. We told him to proceed to refund our debit card for the order. And he still felt the need to argue with her about it. Dont bother with this one unless you want yelled at.

Okay, since my review in 2013, I have been back several times and Portofino's definitely deserves an update/upgrade. So, as for the pizza. I recommend just ordering a small pizza rather than a slice at lunch because they do have some good darn pizza. I have tried multiple toppings including green peppers, olives, shrimp and have loved them all. I also have enjoyed their specialty pizzas too.  Note: I do order my pizza extra crisply. That way the dough is cooked just right and the crust is a little crispy! As for their entrees, you cannot go wrong with anything they offer. They have a variety of specials every night, but if you want to stick with a standard I recommend the Chicken Parmigiana, Shrimp Scampi (expect a garlic flavor) or the Meat Ravioli.  Service is always spot on, from the hostesses, bartenders, waiters and wait staff. Portofino's is my go to spot for good Italian and great prices in Charlotte.

Bravo!  Viva Portofino's!  Great pizza, truly a gem in the Arboretum neighborhood.  The fact that the price is reasonable only makes the value that Portofino's gives you that much better.  Service is great, and the Italian accent coming from behind the counter is like a warm blanket reassuring you that your food will take longer than usual, but will be worth every extra second you have to wait for it.  It is crowded, be warned!  Don't expect to swing by on a Friday evening for a quick bite.  Such is the price you have to pay when your food is so delish!
Went with party of five on a Saturday night. Great service and good food. Had chicken parmigiana and pizza. Lots of food for the money and you always feel welcomed.
Food was good, not phenomenal. Service was good. Very clean. Overall enjoyed the experience.
Pretty good food, I gave a 3 star because my take out order was wrong... I will definitely go back, but I will go in to order takeout instead of calling...

A Charlotte, Southpark neighborhood restaurant frequented by locals. This restaurant does not deserve a 4-5 rating. Average food, I can smoke these guys in my kitchen at home, but my kitchen was 500 miles away today. Big portions, I had the Chicken Taratino with Angel Hair Pasta $14.95. Weak side salad with dated ingredients. Yes, the meal was okay, but overpriced for the level of quality. The wine list was intriguing with all Italian wines. I had the Velenosi Brecciarolo 2002 and found it to be excellent. Great wine prices on wines you might not know about. It did irritate me that they serve wine in the small cheap wine glasses that only hold 3-4 ounces when not completely filled. My issue is price value. Lets stack it up, Mini shopping center location, good service, but very average food at somewhat inflated prices. They have Serv Safe Certification (displayed on the wall in the bar) which is is good. Big pizza carry out business. Pizza is cooked in a deck oven, so off to a good start.  I liked the service and the staff was friendly. This is not a BAM!...sorry!! See my other review for a serious Italian alternative in Charlotte.

there is better italian restaurant than this the food is mediocre I had veal marsala i taste garlic my son had alfredo with a ton of garlic too I am sorry to cook italian you don't put garlic in every dish my wife order tiramisu was frozen in the middle no thanks never again

We found Portofinos a few months ago and have been back many times since.  The food is delicious, the service is wonderful with knowledgeable servers who can help point you in the right direction if you are caught in that enviable position where you can't decide between the three items on the menu that sound incredible.    The music is just right and the cold, crunchy salad and the warm bread just give you an idea of the wonderful things to come.    The chicken parm is out of this world and is a steady favorite for me while my wife tries something different each time all with the same end result that Portofino's on Park Road in one of our favorite restaurants in Charlotte.

Everyone is raving about how great this place is. I've been to twice, but each time, the food was decent and service was good, but not mesmerizing... It is open from lunch all day, so if I happened to be around and wanted to go somewhere at an odd hr (say 3pm), I go here. Maybe I haven't tried enough on the menu yet, but so far, everything seems average to me.

Portofino's nails it with delicious food, great/prompt service and a nice atmosphere. I've been to both locations for lunch, but this will be just for the one off Park.   We arrived at about 1:30pm for lunch, which is sometimes an awkward time to eat at a restaurant; the lunch rush is over, the cook is ready to prep for dinner and the servers are ready for their shift to slow down! Fortunately, we were promptly seated at a great table outside by the fountain. Our server was pretty knowledgeable of the food and seemed to have actually tasted all of them. She couldn't quite pronounce gnocchi in the specials, but the food and service was so good it didn't really matter!  I had my "usual" the boscaiola with penne and their great side salad with house dressing. The dressing is very light, but delish. The bread is always warm and crusty (crusty good, not "I wore these jeans 20 times before I washed them" crusty). And that boscaiola sauce is like heaven on a plate!!! The peas! The prosciutto! The creaminess! It all comes together in an amazingly perfect way that leaves you wishing the plate had more than the 4 servings it comes with! BEWARE! You will want to eat all of it! Try to resist and take some home! I highly recommend adding some crushed red pepper flake to the sauce if you give it a go, adds a nice kick! My co-worker had the special portobello ravioli, planned on saving a couple to take home, but couldn't resist the deliciousness!  I highly recommend Portofino's. The food is great and even if the staff can't pronounce all of the food on the menu, they're all still great!

Disclaimer: I am not Italian.   I feel like I have to get that out of the way because Italians are some of the most opinionated foodies I've ever met in my entire life and HEAVEN FORBID I say something ignorant about their cuisine. So here is a review from a born and raised southern gal with an appreciation for  all things that come in marinara sauce:  I really like Portofino's. I had the luck of working in the same shopping center as this particular location and it quickly became my go-to for my lunch (great specials) and dinner options. I can tell that this is much closer to an authentic style of food than a lot of other mainstream Italian places and it has definitely helped me to refine my expectations.   All of their pasta dishes are phenomenal (OH- and as an added bonus- a New Yorker Italian friend of mine said that this was the best pasta he's had in Charlotte- so take his word if you have to). I also really enjoy their pizzas (the white pizza with spinach is perfect). The only thing I wasn't crazy about were their sandwich options- but I didn't spend my time trying to familiarize myself with this portion of their menu like I did everything else.   Good food. Super quick with orders to go. I would give 4.5 stars but apparently that's not an option.

One of those places I have to eat at every once in a while.  I've had a few different items on the menu and sampled a few of my wife's selections over the years, and everything has been phenomenal.  Easily one of the best Italian restaurants in Charlotte, the service is always above average and the food is appropriately priced.  I personally recommend.  - If you get salad, the only way to go is their house dressing. - Stromboli, it's huge, it's meaty, and it's cheesy, what else do you want? - Nothing washes down a nice Italian dinner better than a glass of Chianti. So have two.

Yesterday was my first time eating here. I sat outside. The food was delicious, fast service, and our server and the staff kept checking on our table to ensure we were taken care off. Definitely going back.
